title: (x) Type in the paperback novel "Memoirs of a Geisha" - Herculanum {Cerilene}
content:
I have been reading the novel "Memoirs of a Geisha" and am curious to know what the font is they used to label and start each chapter. I apologize for the crooked scan!

Thanks!  
Jasmine

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [MemoirsofAGeishaFont0015.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110620235209/http:/typophile.com/files/MemoirsofAGeishaFont0015.jpg) | 82.83 KB |
author: MissJasmine

comments.content:
Is it Herculanum? :)  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/herculanum/herculanum/](http://web.archive.org/web/20110620235209/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/herculanum/herculanum/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/herculanum/herculanum/")

It looks like it, although there are some differences.... ??? :)
Second succesful identification today. You're on a roll, Cerilene!

Hah! :) I think I've found the secret... Come on a Friday night when all the cool typophiles are out doing like, cool typographer type things, and then I have time to ID 'em before they get back. ;) ;) ;)

I know, I'm not cool, I'm just the cleaning lady here. ;^)

:^D

\*LOL\*, See, now I knew you were going to say that, but I saw that you were in Belgium and I didn't think it would be a Friday night for you... :) But after checking worldtimeserver.com, it's apparent that I'm worse at global time zones than Font ID'ing!! :-O!!!!!

:)
